topics.body:
"@Silent_Witness":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5411085763687260087c0000#post_5411085763687260087c0000

Nothing does!

It's a storytelling medium and like everything, there will be people who like something more for one reason or another.

But like any medium, there are works that just entirely derail their subject and while they have some good elements, there is stuff like NGE or recently (I apologize for it) Naruto.

Is that both author and readers end up collapsing the work.

The premise of NGE for example, is what every mecha fan wanted: The psychological and emotional baggage of having a teenager to pilot a mecha and being forced to carry the weight of peoples lives.

Where it falls down is in it's use of Faux Symbolism and Cynical viewpoints which make the whole ride a chore due to being to depressive.

Ahnd then there's the fans who, like the old saying says, every form of medium is someone's first. And in this case, many had never watched mecha or anime before Evangelion came in and, remember for a moment that first time you saw something? Yeah, we all shouted "THIS IS THE BEST THING EVER!!"
